main.name: Marco Guida
main.description: I’m a software developer with an entrepreneurial flare and am experienced in working across the full tech stack, especially for mobile. I’m objective-driven - I code because I love seeing my products used in the hands of people around the world.
main.bio: I’m a junior software developer with experience working on the full stack of multiple software products. For front-end, I’ve primarily worked with React Native for constructing mobile apps, and now am exploring native development for iOS and Android. For back-end, I’ve worked on Java micro services during internships and have developed my own back-ends with AWS + MongoDB, including user auth, REST APIs, and data and asset storage. I’ve also worked in an assortment of other fields, from supervised learning and neural networks for machine learning projects, to UI/UX designing of logos, glyphs, marketing material with Sketch. Interested in connecting or collaborating? Let's get in touch!

work.title: Founder
work.description:
The cannabis industry is one of few that has severely lagged in tech, in large part due to legal complications. With more and more countries legalizing marijuana, consumers want a simple and intuitive experience to finding cannabis perfect for them, both for recreational and medical purposes. Joyleaf is that experience.
Joyleaf is a strain finder app on iOS and Android that lets you discover over 2,000 unique marijuana strains from around the world so you can find cannabis perfect for you.
I led a team of three other developers, who primarily worked on front-end development and algorithm design for our REST API.
I used Xamarin Forms, a .NET cross-platform UI framework, to deliver a smooth, native, front-end experience for both iOS and Android, with a C#-shared codebase to boost development workflow.
I developed the back-end with Firebase in order to authenticate users, store app data, and host a REST API.
I also used Sketch and Photoshop to design all the visual components, including the app icon, splash screens, promotional media, and all the glyphs in the app.

work.title: React Native Front-End Developer Intern
work.description:
I led the development of the PMI Chapter Event Scanner mobile app available on the App Store and Google Play Store for Project Management Institute (PMI), a global client of MG2 Media. The app enables PMI event hosts to seamlessly check-in guests with a QR code scanner and spans 40 PMI locations across North America, from Montreal to Hawaii.
I used React Native, an open-source mobile application framework, to develop the front-end for both iOS and Android. I also worked with Redux to properly manage application state, and communicated with back-end teams to facilitate communications with the server via a REST API.
